hanzi-su-wiki:
殿

Значения

Господин; дворец

Мнемоника

Место, где совместными 共 усилиями порют 殳 по сидячему месту 尸. Дворец; господин (с правом наказывать).

heisig_chinese_memo: Mr. President! We all stand here together under a national flag in the ceremonial hall. One thing is certain: we'll never give in. We are launching nuclear missiles now to implement mutually assured destruction protocol.

koohiiStory1: Mr. President in his palace, ordering missiles to be fired at a harmless enemy in order to unite us together under the flag.
koohiiStory2: Mr. President! We all stand here together under a national flag. One thing is certain: we´ll never give in. We are launching nuclear missiles now to implement mutually assured destruction protocol.

宮殿(きゅうでん): palace
殿(しんがり): rear, rear unit guard
神殿(しんでん): temple, sacred place
沈殿(ちんでん): precipitation, settlement
殿様(とのさま): feudal lord
jp_readingExamples: 殿堂 (でんどう), 宮殿 (きゅうでん), 貴殿 (きでん), 殿 (との), 殿 (どの)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Under the same flag, all the people get together to present a new weapon to your lord. You all bow and say, "Milord, this gift is for you." Because that's the proper way to address your lord.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: When you address your lord you better say "milord," otherwise you might get beheaded with the weapon you're all giving him.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: As you give the lord his weapon together, you see his face turn into a frown, "What's wrong, Milord?" you ask. "THERE'S A DENT (でん)!" he bellows.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Oh no, oh no, oh no! Now the lord is running around with his dented weapon trying to put dents in all of you. You don't want a dent in your head! Run!

humanum_short_description_en:
" Dian " Xiao Zhuan made " 𣪍 ", originally refers to the sound of hitting. "Shuowen": "𣪍, the sound of hits. From the sound of the pan 𡱂." Duan Yucai's note: "The original meaning of this word is not seen, and it is a palace word." And then: ""Erya": "No room is called a palace. "Guo's Note: "This is the current hall." However, there is no room to call it the hall. It is also called the hall of the army."



" Hall " in ancient times generally refers to tall houses, and later generations are used as palaces for emperors to govern or houses to worship gods and Buddhas. "Han Shu. "Huo Guangzhuan": "The owl counts on the tree in front of the temple." Yan Shi's ancient note: "The ancient house is tall, and it is called the ears of the temple, not only in the womb." Du Fu "Five poems of ancient monuments": "Cui" Hua imagined in the empty mountain, in the emptiness of the Jade Temple."



" Temple " also means that the march is at the end, meaning the last. "rhyme. San Yun: "The army is at the front and it is Qi, and the back is the hall." "Guang Ya. Interpretation IV": "Dian, Hou Ye."



Also "Er Ya": "Dian 㕧, groan." Guo Pu's note: "The sound of groans." "Poetry. "Xiaoya" "Fang Dian Shi of the People", "Shu Wen" is used as " Nian ", "Dian 㕧" and "Dian Shi" are also used as "Nian 㕧", "𣣈 㕧", etc. See also "念", "㕧" , " Shit ."
humanum_short_description:
「殿」小篆作「𣪍」，本指擊聲。《說文》：「𣪍，擊聲也。从殳𡱂聲。」段玉裁注：「此字本義未見，假借為宮殿字。」又云：「《爾雅》：『無室曰榭。』郭注：『即今堂堭。』然則無室謂之殿矣。又假借為軍後曰殿。」

　　

　　「殿」於古代泛指高大的房屋，後世則作為皇帝施政的殿堂或供奉神佛的屋宇。《漢書．霍光傳》：「鴞數鳴殿前樹上。」顏師古注：「古者室屋高大，則通呼為殿耳，非止天子宮中。」杜甫《詠懷古蹟五首》：「翠華想像空山裏，玉殿虛無野寺中。」

　　

　　「殿」又表示行軍走在最後，有末後之意。《韻．散韻》：「軍在前曰啟，後曰殿。」《廣雅．釋詁四》：「殿，後也。」

　　

　　又《爾雅》：「殿㕧，呻也。」郭璞注：「呻吟之聲。」《詩．小雅》「民之方殿屎」，《說文》作「唸」，「殿㕧」、「殿屎」又作「唸㕧」、「𣣈㕧」等，參見「唸」、「㕧」、「屎」。

殿字的基本解释

殿
diàn
高大的房屋，特指帝王所居和朝会的地方，或供奉神佛的地方：宫殿。宝殿。金銮殿。殿堂。殿阁。殿上虎（喻敢谏之臣）。殿试。
〔殿下〕对亲王或太子的敬称。
在最后：殿后。殿军。

殿字的汉语字典释义

[①]［diàn］
［《廣韻》堂練切，去霰，定。］
［《廣韻》都甸切，去霰，端。］
(1)高大房屋的通称。
(2)指帝王宸居。
(3)用作帝、后的代称。
(4)祀奉神佛之所。
(5)居后，在后。
(6)指后军。
(7)考课中最后一等；科举考试中置于后等。
(8)居后而出众。
(9)镇抚；镇守。
(10)定，评定。
(11)见“殿屎”。
(12)停，停叙。
(13)古代刑法计量单位。

殿字的英文翻译

◎ 殿
palace, hall, temple, at the rear

殿字的康熙字典解释
殿字的源字形

殿字的起名意思

：1、殿邦，如安邦定国，镇抚，镇守；2、形容词，最后。

temple
Basic explanation of words
temple
diàn
Tall houses, especially the place where the emperor lived and the court, or the place where gods and Buddhas are worshipped: palaces. Baodian. Golden Temple. Palace. Dian Pavilion. The tiger on the temple (a minister of Yu Ganjian). Palace test.
[His Royal Highness] The honorific title for the prince or prince.
At the end: behind the palace. Third place.
temple
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［diàn］
["Guangyun" Tang practice cutting, go to chao, set. ]
["Guangyun" are all cut, go to chai, end. ]
(1) Generic term for tall houses.
(2) Refers to the residence of the emperor.
(3) Used as a pronoun for emperor and queen.
(4) A place to worship gods and Buddhas.
(5) Behind, behind.
(6) Refers to the rear army.
(7) The last class in the exam; the last class in the imperial examination.
(8) Behind and outstanding.
(9) Zhenfu; guarding.
(10) Determine and evaluate.
(11) See "Dian Shit".
(12) Stop, stop narrating.
(13) Ancient criminal law measurement unit.
temple

храм
выключать.
храм
храм
писец
Кай
diàn
I сущ.
1) зал (дворца, храма, присутствия); дворец; палаты; храм; дворцовый; храмовый
殿里有佛爷 в храме есть Будда (статуя)
2) задняя часть, зад; арьергард; задний, замыкающий, последний
戎车(jū)之殿 задок военной колесницы
殿船 замыкающая джонка
II гл.
1) быть задним (последним); быть в арьергарде; замыкать (колонну)
奔而殿 быть замыкающим при поспешном отступлении (бегстве)
2) устанавливать мир, умиротворять; наводить порядок
殿天子之邦 утверждать державу сына неба, наводить порядок в империи
III местоим
яп., вежл. Вы, Ваш (к старшему)
Radicals: 尸, 共, 殳  (flag, together, weapon)
Meaning Mnemonic
Under the same flag, all the people get together to present a new weapon to your lord. You all bow and say, "Milord, this gift is for you." Because that's the proper way to address your lord.
When you address your lord you better say "milord," otherwise you might get beheaded with the weapon you're all giving him.
Reading Mnemonic
As you give the lord his weapon together, you see his face turn into a frown, "What's wrong, Milord?" you ask. "THERE'S A DENT (でん)!" he bellows.
Oh no, oh no, oh no! Now the lord is running around with his dented weapon trying to put dents in all of you. You don't want a dent in your head! Run!
